Chickpea Quinoa Salad

Jump to Recipe

Welcome to a refreshing culinary adventure with our vibrant Chickpea Quinoa Salad! This nutrient-dense dish is not only packed with protein and fiber, making it a perfect choice for a healthy lunch or dinner, but it also bursts with fresh flavors that will tantalize your taste buds. Combining the nutty goodness of quinoa with the earthy richness of chickpeas, this salad is a fantastic way to incorporate plant-based ingredients into your diet. Featuring colorful cherry tomatoes, crisp cucumbers, and aromatic parsley, each bite offers a satisfying crunch. Tossed in a zesty olive oil and lemon dressing, this Chickpea Quinoa Salad is as appealing to the eye as it is to the palate. Ideal for meal prep, picnics, or a quick weeknight dinner, this recipe is not just easy to make but also incredibly versatile. Let’s dive into the details and discover how to create this deliciously healthy salad that’s sure to become a staple in your kitchen!

Ingredients

quinoa

Make sure to rinse the quinoa thoroughly under cold water to remove its natural coating, called saponin, which can impart a bitter flavor. If you don’t have quinoa, you can substitute it with couscous, millet, or rice, but cooking times and water ratios may vary.

canned chickpeas (drained and rinsed)

Rinsing canned chickpeas not only removes excess sodium but also helps improve their flavor. If you prefer, you can use cooked dry chickpeas instead; soak them overnight and boil until tender. For a different flavor, try using white beans or kidney beans.

cherry tomatoes (halved)

Choose ripe, vibrant cherry tomatoes for the best flavor. If you don’t have cherry tomatoes, you can use regular tomatoes diced into small pieces. Roasting the tomatoes before adding them can enhance their sweetness.

cucumber (diced)

To prevent the salad from getting watery, you can seed the cucumber before dicing. If you don't have cucumber, zucchini or bell peppers can work as refreshing alternatives.

red onion (finely chopped)

Soaking the chopped red onion in cold water for 10 minutes can help reduce its sharpness. If red onion is too pungent for your taste, use green onions or shallots instead.

fresh parsley (chopped)

Fresh parsley adds a burst of flavor and color; for a similar flavor profile, you can substitute with cilantro or basil. If you use dried parsley, remember that it’s less potent, so use about a tablespoon instead.

olive oil

Use high-quality extra virgin olive oil for the best flavor. If you want to reduce calories, you can substitute half of it with vegetable broth or water for a lighter dressing.

lemon juice

Freshly squeezed lemon juice is preferable for flavor. If you don’t have lemons, lime juice or vinegar (like apple cider or red wine) can be used as substitutes.

salt

Start with a small amount and adjust to taste, as the chickpeas may already contain some salt. If you're watching sodium intake, consider using a salt substitute or herbs to enhance flavor.

black pepper

Freshly cracked black pepper will provide a more robust flavor than pre-ground. You can also experiment with different pepper varieties, such as white or pink peppercorns, for unique tastes.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Rinse the Quinoa

    Start by rinsing 1 cup of quinoa under cold running water for about 1-2 minutes. This step is crucial as it helps remove the saponins, a natural coating that can make quinoa taste bitter. Use a fine mesh strainer to ensure you don’t lose any grains.

  • Step 2: Cook the Quinoa

    In a medium-sized pot, combine the rinsed quinoa with 2 cups of water. Bring the mixture to a boil over high heat. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and cover the pot with a lid. Let it simmer for 15 minutes, or until all the water has been absorbed. After cooking, remove the pot from heat and let it sit, covered, for an additional 5 minutes. Fluff the quinoa with a fork and spread it out on a plate or bowl to cool more quickly.

  • Step 3: Prepare the Salad Ingredients

    While the quinoa is cooking, prepare your salad ingredients. Halve 1 cup of cherry tomatoes, dice 1 medium cucumber, and finely chop 1/4 medium red onion. Also, chop 1/4 cup of fresh parsley. Make sure the pieces are uniform for a better presentation and easier eating.

  • Step 4: Combine Salad Components

    In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooled quinoa, drained and rinsed canned chickpeas (1 can, 15 oz), halved cherry tomatoes, diced cucumber, chopped red onion, and parsley. Use a spatula or wooden spoon to gently fold the ingredients together, ensuring everything is evenly mixed.

  • Step 5: Make the Dressing

    In a small bowl, whisk together 3 tablespoons of olive oil, 2 tablespoons of fresh lemon juice, and season with salt and black pepper to taste. Adjust the seasoning based on your preference; a pinch of salt can enhance the flavors.

  • Step 6: Dress the Salad

    Pour the dressing over the salad mixture in the large bowl. Toss gently to coat all the ingredients with the dressing, ensuring that nothing gets mushy. Allow it to rest for about 10 minutes to let the flavors meld together.

  • Step 7: Serve the Salad

    Chickpea quinoa salad can be served chilled or at room temperature. This salad is versatile and can be enjoyed as a main dish or as a side. Garnish with additional parsley if desired.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I rinse quinoa properly?

Place the quinoa in a fine-mesh strainer and rinse it under cold running water for about 1-2 minutes. This helps remove the natural coating called saponin, which can make quinoa taste bitter.

What is the correct water-to-quinoa ratio for cooking?

The general rule is to use 2 cups of water for every 1 cup of quinoa. This will ensure that the quinoa cooks properly and absorbs all the water.

How do I know when quinoa is done cooking?

Quinoa is done when it has absorbed all the water and the grains have expanded, becoming fluffy. You should see the little ‘tails’ or germ separating from the grains.

What can I substitute for canned chickpeas?

If you don't have canned chickpeas, you can use cooked dried chickpeas. Just soak them overnight and boil them until tender, or use other legumes like black beans or kidney beans.

How do I cut a cucumber and tomatoes for the salad?

For the cucumber, wash it, then slice it in half lengthwise and scoop out the seeds with a spoon. Cut it into small dice. For cherry tomatoes, simply slice them in half.

What is the best way to chop red onion without crying?

Chill the onion in the fridge for 30 minutes before chopping. Use a sharp knife and cut under running water, or breathe through your mouth while cutting to minimize tears.

Can I make this salad in advance?

Yes! This salad can be made a few hours in advance. Just wait to add the dressing until you're ready to serve to keep the ingredients fresh.

How should I store leftovers?

Store any leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator. It should be good for about 3-4 days.

What can I use instead of olive oil?

You can substitute olive oil with other oils like avocado oil or canola oil. You could also use yogurt or a tahini dressing for a different flavor.

How can I make this salad more filling?

Add some diced avocado, grilled chicken, or feta cheese to make the salad more hearty and satisfying.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This salad is naturally gluten-free, vegan, and high in protein and fiber, making it suitable for a variety of dietary preferences. For a lower-carb version, you could substitute quinoa with cauliflower rice. For added flavor, consider including feta cheese for a Mediterranean twist or avocado for creaminess.

Pairings

This Chickpea Quinoa Salad pairs wonderfully with grilled chicken or shrimp for added protein, or you can serve it alongside roasted vegetables for a vegetarian option. For beverages, consider a light white wine like Sauvignon Blanc or a refreshing iced herbal tea, such as mint or hibiscus, which complements the freshness of the salad.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the salad in a large, shallow bowl to showcase the colorful ingredients. Garnish with additional parsley or lemon zest for a vibrant touch. If serving at a gathering, consider presenting individual portions in mason jars for a fun and portable option. This salad is perfect for picnics or potlucks, as it can be made ahead of time and served cold or at room temperature.

Chickpea Quinoa Salad

25 min
$10
300 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 4

Dietary Tags:

VegetarianVeganGluten-Free

Cuisine:

MediterraneanAmerican

Course:

SaladMain Dish

Tags:

SaladHealthyQuickEasy

Description

A refreshing and nutritious salad packed with protein, fiber, and vibrant flavors.

Ingredients

  • quinoa: 1 cup
  • canned chickpeas (drained and rinsed): 1 can (15 oz)
  • cherry tomatoes (halved): 1 cup
  • cucumber (diced): 1 medium
  • red onion (finely chopped): 1/4 medium
  • fresh parsley (chopped): 1/4 cup
  • olive oil: 3 tablespoons
  • lemon juice: 2 tablespoons
  • salt: to taste
  • black pepper: to taste
